author: @WNGdotorg
title: Health Department to cut 10,000 employees
text:
Health Department to cut 10,000 employees
The U.S. Department of Health and Human Services on Thursday announced it was firing about 10,000 full-time employees and combining several departments in what it called a dramatic restructuring. The department plans to cut its workforce from 82,000 to about 62,000 through layoffs and early retirement. The reduction will save taxpayers about $1.8 billion a year, the department said.
The Health Department’s 28 divisions will be consolidated into just 15, with several merging to form the new Administration for a Healthy America, or AHA. The department said the changes came in response to President Donald Trump’s executive order directing the Department of Government Efficiency to oversee reductions in the federal workforce.
What are other reasons for the changes? Health Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. in a Thursday video announcing the transformation said the Health Department had failed to make Americans healthier, despite a 38% increase in funding and 17% increase in staffing under the Biden administration. The United States trails other developed nations in health statistics despite spending more, Kennedy said.
How does Kennedy plan to improve Health Department services? Kennedy said he planned to cut administrative positions while hiring more scientists. He also promised services like Medicare and Medicaid would not be negatively affected. The secretary slammed what he characterized as siloed subagencies for selling patient data to each other rather than sharing resources. He said the planned department mergers would improve communication and stop wasteful spending. However, Kennedy admitted the department has a painful period ahead as it adjusts to the changes.

title: Donald Trump Accuses President Joe Biden of Being 'Evil' and Persecuting Christians at Nashville Convention
text: Former President Donald Trump accused President Joe Biden of persecuting Christians and criticized the treatment of migrants pouring into the country via " steak mountain ." In a speech delivered at the National Religious Broadcasters International Christian Media Convention in Nashville, Tenn. , Trump, known for his controversial statements, attacked President Biden over his administration's treatment of migrants entering America. "The people are pouring over. It’s sort of known as Steak Mountain Steak Hill. Snake. Snake. A lot of snakes. Think they’re rattlesnakes," Trump ranted. "Between the rattlesnakes and the rough terrain and the steepness, they said nobody’s coming over — the people coming over by the thousands! It’s crazy! And we let them come over. We let them do it." "Our country can’t withstand, no country can withstand what’s happening to us. The cities are being inundated. They’re being overrun. They’re taking the parks from children. No more baseball fields. No more soccer fields, no more anything," he continued. "Their way of life has changed, and they’re being treated better than long-time American citizens. And they’re being treated better than our soldiers, our veterans are being treated." Trump then switched topics to how he perceives Christians are treated in the U.S., claiming the Biden administration will lock up religious leaders. "Let’s call these brave Americans what they really are, persecuted. Christians, they’re being persecuted. And let’s call their imprisoned, and imprisonment," he told those at the convention. "They are being imprisoned by Joe Biden and his people, evil people! He’s surrounded by very evil people!" The alleged imprisoned Christians Trump was referring to were anti-abortion protesters convicted by a Tennessee jury of violating the Freedom of Access to Clinic Entrances Act . "They are, I believe, just doing whatever they want to do. I don’t believe they have any leadership at all," the ex-prez continued. "Joe Biden, because of his gross incompetence, is a threat to democracy, big threat to democracy ." Trump ended his speech by claiming that the moment he wins re-election , he will "appoint a special task force to rapidly review the cases of every political prisoner who has been unjustly victimized by the Biden regime." Trump's comments were heavily criticized on social media for his speech and alleged "fake fawning" over Christian religious groups. One user on X, formerly known as Twitter , shared a clip of Trump's speech in a viral post that read, "It’s always amusing when Trump attempts to talk about the subject he knows less about than any other — Christianity." Another user commented, "It’s such nonsense that the Christian fanatics are trying to impose their morality on the entire country, while at the same time embracing Trump, the least moral politician I have ever seen." A third person wrote, "I would kill for one person to ask Trump to recite one verse from the bible. The man's never once read a word of scripture."

author: @infobae
title: La impresionante campaña de un youtuber que eliminó toneladas de basura marina - Infobae
text:
Los youtubers Mr. Beast y Mark Rober para Team Seas (Crédito: Captura de Video) James Donaldson , conocido como MrBeast en YouTube , ha marcado un hito significativo en la lucha contra la contaminación oceánica. Desde que lanzó la iniciativa TeamSeas en octubre de 2021, el objetivo era ambicioso: recaudar 30 millones de dólares y eliminar 15 millones de kg de basura de los océanos y ríos del mundo. La meta financiera fue alcanzada rápidamente, recaudando el total necesario antes de enero de 2022.
Al anunciar el éxito del proyecto el 16 de julio de 2024, MrBeast confirmó que la limpieza superó las expectativas, eliminando 15 millones de kilos de basura. “A partir de hoy, los 15 millones de kilos de basura de TeamSeas han sido retirados del océano y verificados por un tercero”, publicó en redes sociales. Este logro fue posible gracias a una organización meticulosa que involucró la contratación de especialistas, la movilización de voluntarios y el uso de tecnología avanzada , como robots limpiadores.
MrBeast no estuvo solo en esta campaña. Mark Rober , otro influyente YouTuber , se unió como coprotagonista del proyecto. Además, aliados como Ocean Conservancy y Ocean Cleanup proporcionaron el respaldo técnico necesario. GNN informó que parte de los fondos recaudados se destinó a equipar a los voluntarios con suministros adecuados y a pagar los servicios de especialistas y barcos, esenciales para la recolección masiva de basura.
Los voluntarios limpiando los ríos y océanos (Crédito: Captura de Video) El impacto de la campaña TeamSeas no se limitó solo a la recaudación de fondos y la limpieza directa. El proyecto movilizó a 170.000 voluntarios de decenas de países. Además, generó una notable visibilidad en Internet, acumulando 1.300 millones de visualizaciones en 40.000 canales sociales . Esta masiva participación digital fue crucial para dirigir la atención hacia el sitio web de TeamSeas , lo que facilitó las donaciones y aumentó la conciencia sobre la contaminación marina.
Figuras prominentes de diversos campos también se unieron a la causa. Artistas de EDM como Tiesto y Zedd , y el multimillonario Austin Russell , contribuyeron a dar visibilidad y apoyo financiero. La participación de estos individuos destacó la iniciativa en plataformas mediáticas, lo que facilitó una mayor difusión del mensaje. “Este logro no habría sido posible sin la cooperación de todos”, agradeció MrBeast en uno de los videos promocionales de TeamSeas .
Eliminaron 15 millones de kilos de basura (Crédito: Captura de Video) Este proyecto es una muestra del poder de la colaboración digital y su capacidad para generar cambios tangibles. MrBeast , con su notable influencia en YouTube –donde ya ha superado los 30 millones de suscriptores en junio de 2024–, ha demostrado que Internet puede ser una herramienta poderosa para causas benéficas. Sus otros proyectos, como TeamTrees , que plantó 20 millones de árboles antes de 2020, y el lanzamiento de MrBeast Burger y Feastables , refuerzan su legado filantrópico.
Además de sus esfuerzos ambientales, MrBeast ha realizado numerosos actos de caridad. El 4 de julio, GNN informó que había construido 100 casas para familias afectadas por desastres en América Central y del Sur . Otros de sus esfuerzos benéficos incluyen el pago de cirugías de cataratas y el financiamiento de implantes cocleares .
El éxito de TeamSeas subraya la importancia de la participación comunitaria y la capacidad transformadora de las redes sociales. Según Complex , la combinación de voluntariado, donaciones y contenido digital ha sido fundamental para limpiar los océanos. Las colaboraciones con organizaciones especializadas, la movilización de recursos y la sensibilización pública han permitido un impacto significativo en la salud de nuestros océanos.
El después de las playas que limpiaron los voluntarios (Crédito: Captura de Video) La campaña TeamSeas ha sido un testimonio del poder de la colaboración y la tecnología digital para abordar problemas ambientales complejos. A medida que MrBeast sigue innovando y movilizando a su vasta audiencia, el mundo observa con interés su próxima iniciativa. “Es el mundo de MrBeast y nosotros simplemente vivimos en él”, afirmó en uno de sus videos, reflejando su constante impulso de generar cambios positivos.
La impresionante eliminación de 34 millones de libras de basura del océano demuestra que, con determinación y colaboración, es posible enfrentar incluso los desafíos más grandes. La pregunta que queda es: ¿qué otros problemas ambientales deben abordar los influencers y sus seguidores? La respuesta reside en la capacidad de las plataformas digitales para inspirar acción y movilizar recursos en beneficio de causas cruciales.

author: Anthony Nlebem
title: AFCON: Odegbami drums support for Super Eagles
text:
Former Nigeria captain, Dr. Patrick Olusegun Odegbami has called on Nigerians at home and in the diaspora to believe and support the
Super Eagles to triumph at the ongoing 2023 Africa Cup of Nations ( AFCON) in Ivory Coast.
Speaking on his radio programme on Eagle FM on Saturday morning, the one known as ‘The Mathematical’ in his playing days reiterated his much-vaunted belief that Nigeria will emerge champions of the continent for the fourth time at the final tournament in Ivory Coast, and called on all Nigerians to do their bit in their place and sector to back the team’s campaign.
“I have unflagging confidence that this team will do it again. I have been saying it for some weeks now and the belief is getting stronger by the day, Odegbami said on his radio show.
“That is why I drove from Nigeria with my team, across the stretch of one thousand and one hundred kilometres of single carriageway, all to cheer the team to victory.
“Some people have said that anytime we play or defeat Ivory Coast at the AFCON, we go all the way to the final, and even win it. That may be superstitious but there are facts in there.
“Our team was not in a good place before the tournament and the opening game against Equatorial Guinea was not reassuring, but the victory over the host nation and one of the strong favourites has turned things around and we’re looking good.”
Odegbami is a legend of the African game. He was the top scorer of the 1980 finals that Nigeria hosted and won, in the process battling Cote d’Ivoire to a scoreless draw in a group phase encounter.
‘The Mathematical’ scored 23 goals for Nigeria in an international career that spanned seven years, during which he won the AFCON gold and two bronze medals, played at the 1980 Olympics after the Nigeria team was recalled from the 1976 Olympics as the country led an African boycott of the Montreal Games, and was voted third best player in Africa in 1980.
“I am very much convinced that this is our year and I want Nigerians from high and low places to support the NFF in whichever they can to motivate and galvanise the team. That win over Ivory Coast has strengthened my faith. It takes a champion team to beat the host nation with such self-belief, panache and calmness.”
The Super Eagles have continued their preparation for Monday’s encounter with the Wild Dogs of Guinea Bissau at the Stade Félix Houphouët-Boigny, in which victory will confirm Nigeria as group winners, barring a massacre of the Ivorian Elephants by the Thunder of Equatorial Guinea the same day at the Stade Olympique Alassane Ouattara.
Guinea Bissau’s Dogs are pointless and largely hopeless but could be dangerous on the take as they have nothing to lose on the day.
“We are not in the business of under-rating any team in this tournament,” defender and on-field captain William Ekong said on Saturday afternoon. “Every single team that is here qualified to be here; no one got a free pass. We must approach every match with a business-like mentality. No team ever wins a match before the final whistle.”

title: Microsofters Try to Defund the Free Software Foundation (by Attacking Its Founder This Week) and They Tell People to Instead Give Money to Microsoft Front Groups
text:
Microsofters Try to Defund the Free Software Foundation (by Attacking Its Founder This Week) and They Tell People to Instead Give Money to Microsoft Front Groups
The founder of the Free Software Foundation, [Richard Stallman](https://stallman.org/) (RMS), is still being targeted by some of the same people we sued 2.5 months ago [[1](/n/2024/09/06/Why_We_Are_Suing_Matthew_J_Garrett_for_Harassment_and_Why_It_s_.shtml), [ 2](http://news.tuxmachines.org/n/2024/09/06/Why_Suing_Matthew_J_Garrett_After_Abusing_and_Harassing_My_Husb.shtml)]. It's a matter of agenda, not envy.
Days ago it was said that RMS had earned more doctorates ("[Richard Stallman Earned Two More Honorary Doctorates Last Month](/n/2024/11/21/Richard_Stallman_Earned_Two_More_Honorary_Doctorates_Last_Month.shtml)"), so the Microsofters must be bothered that he still receives recognition (throwing "reports" at him didn't work, it turned out that the authors were themselves perverts who like to collect/harvest [ lollies](/n/2024/11/03/Life_of_an_Addicted_Lolicon_Who_Can_Also_Code.shtml), then [ censor anyone who talks about it](/n/2024/11/19/Drew_s_Development_Mailing_Lists_and_Patches_to_Refine_His_Atta.shtml)).
Older: [ The Real FSF Lost Well Over a Million Dollars Since the Defamation Attacks on Its Founder](/n/2024/06/21/The_Real_FSF_Lost_Well_Over_a_Million_Dollars_Since_the_Defamat.shtml) (RMS)
The attacks on him (from [ "people who live in glass houses"](/n/2024/11/04/People_who_live_in_glass_houses_shouldn_t_throw_stones.shtml)) have since intensified. They tell people to instead give money to [ a Microsoft front group](/n/2024/11/16/If_You_Donate_to_the_FSFE_You_Are_Funding_a_Microsoft_Front_Gro.shtml) which fakes [the FSF](/o/2020/08/22/fsf-fsfe-dispute/) (in effect identity theft, according to the FSF's chief) and [silences critics](/o/2021/12/22/fsfe-censorship/).
The FSF is raising money.
Just over [ 10,000 dollars in 3 days](/n/2024/11/19/The_Free_Software_Foundation_is_Looking_to_Raise_Nearly_Half_a_.shtml):
So far money is raised at a pace of about 100,000 dollars per month.
Meanwhile, Microsoft people try to outspend their critics and harass them. This won't end well for them. [█](#top)
